description: Learn how to make your website responsive and adaptable to different devices and screen sizes.

slides.title: What is Responsive Design?
slides.content:
# Responsive Design üì±

Responsive Web Design makes your web page look good on all devices.

Responsive web design uses only HTML and CSS.

Responsive web design is not a program or a JavaScript.

It relies heavily on **Media Queries** to apply different styles based on viewport size.

slides.title: The Viewport Meta Tag
slides.content:
# The Viewport Tag üè∑Ô∏è

A critical step for responsive design.

Example:
```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
```

- `width=device-width`: Sets the width of the page to follow the screen-width of the device.
- `initial-scale=1.0`: Sets the initial zoom level when the page is first loaded.

Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Media Queries üéì

One site, every device.

- **Rule:** `@media only screen and (condition) { ... }`
- **Breakpoints:** `min-width` (mobile-first) vs `max-width`.
- **Viewport Tag:** Requires `<meta name="viewport" ...>`.
- **Adapt:** Columns -> Rows, Hide elements, Scale text.
